comment:
DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS WITH DR.OMIDVAR. 

I signed up to take World Lit online with him in spring of 2024. I am an A student in all of my other classes and thought that I would keep up with the class... I did for a while, until he released his commentary for our midterms. He failed the majority of the class. 

LISTEN. DO NOT TAKE THIS PROFESSOR.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: Lots of work to the point i could not keep up with his class and had to drop it. If you have other classes that have lots of homework find another prof. This class will eat up your time. Each week you must read about 20 or more pages from one of three books that are required and watch a few hour long lecture were he drones on and it get very boring
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Lecture heavy

comment: Today's the last class and he hasn't graded things from 5 weeks ago. I read the reviews and thought, "Just a heavy work load." It's not the work load. He doesn't want you to succeed. He wants you to struggle so he can feed his ego that he has a "demanding" class. TRUST ME- don't take him. I've never seen a Groupme so full of hatred and frustration.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Group projects--Lots of homework

comment: Please do not take this class. He makes you teach yourself all of the material, then you grade your peers' assignments. Instructions are unclear. Everyone is struggling in my class. He gives very little time for assignments, especially the Final Essay Portfolio.
rating_tags: Lots of homework

comment: This course is designed in a way that seems like he doesn't realize that you have a life. He expects you to read, re-read, annotate, and take notes on everything, including the LARGE amount of reading he gives. His "small" amounts to read are moderate amounts for other classes. Quizzes include small details you never thought you would need to know.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Lecture heavy

comment: Omidvar is a very passionate professor, but his class is a lot of work. We had several weekly readings and lectures that had quizzes. They were detail heavy, and paying attention is crucial. Getting an A in the class is manageable if you put the work in, but if you don't it's hard to bounce back. He gives detailed feedback and is easy to reach.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Group projects--Lots of homework

comment:
DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS.
please don't take this course you'll easily spend 10 hours a week on it. There are 100 questions for the mid-term and also you will have to write Essay. Usually, 40 % of students drop the class after mid-term. He also doesn't post half of the grades until the end of the semester.There are three other core classes you can get
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--Test heavy

comment: Great professor, cares a lot about his students, just SO MUCH work. I took him online and spent at least 3 hours weekly reading alone. Lectures are boring. Tons of quizzes that ask you details to make sure you read and took notes on the lectures. You have to pay attention in class to get an A, but it is doable. Responds quickly and fair grader.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Caring

comment: You have to stay on top of your work and in the case you can't, all you have to do is communicate that to him. He is understanding as long as he sees you are trying and doing the work. Read through his instructions thoroughly as there is not much room for mistakes, but as long as you don't wait till the last minute you will be fine.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria

comment: DO NOT TAKE THIS PROFESSOR!!!!! He does not care how much you have going on outside of class and gives tons of work every week. He gives ridiculous amounts of work and readings and does group projects with no instruction or guidance. He expects his students to spend 12 hours a week on his class. He is a very hard grader too, no room for mistakes.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Group projects--Lecture heavy

comment: He is by far the toughest grading teacher I have ever had in my life. You can do extremely well in the class, and still receive a B. No matter how hard you try, or how many hours of your day you sacrifice to focus on this class, he still wont give you credit for your hard work. He makes the class extremely tough for his students.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--So many papers--Tough grader

comment: to sum up this prof: grades are due tomorrow at noon and he has yet to grade things from the first week of a semester. weekly quizzes, readings of 20-80 pages each week. don't take this course if you don't have time, you'll easily spend 10 hours a week on it and can still do bad.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Group projects--Lecture heavy

comment: bros, do not take this class unless you want to spend every waking hour of your day on it, the workload is absolutely insane. you could spend ten hours a week doing readings lectures and discussions and still fail the quiz. i'm a student who usually passes with flying colors, this is by far the most difficult and stressful class i have ever taken.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: Be prepared to read a lot if you want to pass this class. There are weekly discussion posts that are a bit different from the usual, but you should be fine if you follow the rubric. Quizzes are difficult so make sure you read and take notes. A solid choice if you need the class but not an easy A.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--So many papers

comment: He's a good teacher, you do need to watch the lectures along with reading the assigned pages if you want a good grade. His class is not difficult to pass but can take up a lot of time with all of the readings. You also want to MAKE SURE you get the right textbooks, if not your grade is going to suffer.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy

comment: Dr. Omidvar requires focus and work for his class. Shocker a class that needs hard-work! I think he is a good professor who genuinely wants to help his students succeed. He just requires a lot of reading in short periods of time. VERY detailed with assignments, so you know what he wants, and he is great at responding to emails. I liked his class.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: Several weekly quizzes over 100+ pages of reading, 1 multiple choice test, 2 papers, 1 group project, and 1-2 discussion boards each week. LONG lectures. Overall a nice professor who is passionate about the subject and gives interesting content, but he is probably one of the toughest graders on all assignments. This class is defs a time commitment.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Group projects--Tough grader

comment: I made another review earlier, but Omidvar doesn't really do a good job in helping guide his students. After I failed my first quiz in his class, I emailed him for help, where he sent me a paragraph that could've been summarized with "read more and take notes" which I was already doing. He also doesn't post half of the grades until end of semester
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--So many papers

comment: Perhaps I'm a bit biased with my rating as I am currently trying to work on my final essay of 1000 words, but I advise you to only consider taking his class if you take less than 9 credit hours. Based off of his workload, he fully assumes you have time to do the pages to read, the lectures to watch, the group projects, etc. How else could anyone?
rating_tags: Get ready to read--So many papers--Tough grader

comment: He posted readings we had to complete on Monday at 2:30-3 am for quizzes due on Wednesday. They were very hefty, 20-30 page long readings that were not easy to digest. Not only that, he would upload 1-2 lecture videos that were 15-40 minutes long. Not enough time for work given, do not take him if you won't put in effort. Also, quizzes are not easy
rating_tags: Lecture heavy

comment: His class was well structured and easy for a gen-ed. It was a midterm, quizzes, final paper, discussion posts, and a group project. You will need to read the material in depth to do well on quizzes and go to class. If you follow the instructions well, he is an easy grader. The midterm is hard, but if you read, its better.
rating_tags: Respected--Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: Took his hybrid class. Quiz & post every Friday but he drops 5(?) low ones. Midterm is A LOT but not terrible. You HAVE to read to do well on that & quizzes. Group project wasnt too bad w/ a good group. Overall hes a really cool guy & accessible. He even bumped my grade. Was supposed to end w/ a B no matter what I got on our paper but got an A
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Hilarious

comment: This class is broing, no other way to put it. The material is dry and im sure he knows it he tries to engage the class as much as possible. Midterm is 100 questions over alot of diffrent reading so there is no great way of studying. Group project isnt bad, and the final paper i thought was pretty easy 1000 words
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Group projects

comment: He is a good professor. There were discussion posts every week along with 1-2 quizzes to go with the material written on. One midterm that has 2 parts (100 questions and a short paper). Also a group project, which we were told about a week or so before the first group presented. The final is a 4-5 page paper which isn't that bad.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Group projects

comment: Prof Omidvar does a great job with what could be very dull material. He is absolutely fascinating and really dives in to analyze the stories. That being said, he knows its a gen ed requirement and he doesn't demand too much. Take notes on what he says, and read the book.
rating_tags: Respected--Beware of pop quizzes--Amazing lectures

comment: This professor was horrible, point blank. He is very genuine and nice but is all over the place and if you dont have all three textbooks for this class, you wont pass at all. Discussion posts every week and pop quizzes as well. One midterm, 100 questions thats extremely hard, group project which is complicated, and final paper. It was too much.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Group projects--Lecture heavy

comment: Get ready to read and analyze the most text you have ever done in your life. If you do not read the assigned readings, you will fail. You have to post 300 word discussions and 200 word responses every week over the assigned reading which is very difficult with a heavy classload. The midterm is 100 Qs over all reading which is horrible.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Great teacher. Took for spring worldlit2017 and was my favorite teacher for that semester. The assigned reading was very interesting and his class was not hard to get through. The grade breakdown is not bad and its very easy to see how the class is laid out from week one. If you like world history or writing or reading I highly recommend the class.
rating_tags: Respected--Get ready to read--Caring

comment: Dr. O has a remarkable approach to what could be regarded as particularly drab subject matter. From the start, we were divided into group hiring committees -- 85% of the course is based around this (and these type of activities). The other 15% of the course is devoted to language and visual theories. You'll work hard, but learn lots if you try!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: powerpoint heavy which normally i don't mind but he's really boring. lots of group work.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Does a very good job making sure you grasp the concept of the novels read in class, however, there is a TON of reading. Don't take this professor if you aren't ready for a heavy but manageable workload.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: DO NOT TAKE THIS PROFESSOR! Save yourself the stress. He is unorganized and all over the place. He is vague on his instructions for assignments until after you have already submitted the assignment. He did not give out any grades until the last day to withdraw. He seems like such a sweet guy but this teaching style is horrible.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Prof. Omidvar rarely answers emails, grades strictly without clear guidelines, changes the schedule every other week, gives homework the night before and doesn't tell you about it, and basically, passing this class would be a miracle. He's not a bad guy, he's actually pretty nice, but he is just not a good teacher.  Do not take. My only B in ENGL.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: I cannot stand this class. I agree with the other assessments of this professor. He lacks any organization. He makes decisions at the last minute. He doesn't know how to assign anything other than discussion posts or I-Search essay's. He talks way too much, and  I am pretty sure he doesn't breathe. He rarely responds to emails. He grades too late.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--SO MANY PAPERS

comment: Awful, AWFUL professor. Never responds to emails, has ZERO structure in his course, and the only time he ever gave a grade for anything was months into the course, and that was only after weeks of us hounding him about not having grades. I am not exaggerating at all about that. He never graded anything. DO NOT TAKE THIS PROFESSOR.
rating_tags: Participation matters

comment: Everything is done in group projects so you are constantly relying on other people which is annoying. This professor is not clear and makes these horrible "models" that make no sense and he wants you to refer back to them. The material is interesting but there is little to no class discussion. This class all together is just not enjoyable.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--GROUP PROJECTS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: He has a wonderful personality! He is not very clear about his teaching and grading so you pretty much have to be an overachiever to even pass his class. He gives random quizzes over the readings so make sure you read! His midterm was difficult for me because he asked about specific quotes. Other than that, if you need his help ASK HIM!

Though I nice guy outside of class, Dr. Omidvar's class is a fairly difficult one. Readings on readings on readings with quizzes scattered throughout. The midterm took about 3 weeks to grade (though he does personally give you feedback of the essay portion). pay attention to the reading schedule because he will not mention when readings are due.

Would not take again. He assigns a hefty amount of readings, which you actually have to read (and annotate/ read twice to actually pass the pop quizzes). He takes forever to put in grades and never posts anything helpful online. His lectures take up the whole class and and are very boring.

Majority of class is reading for homework and discussion during the next class. There are pop quizzes, and on the quiz he does ask for quotes and specific details. Must participate in discussions for grades, and discussion posts every week on D2L are a grade (extra credit if you reply to more than one person). Midterm based on past quizzes.
probably one of the best teachers I have had at SPSU. He makes everything interesting and insightful. Mostly a discussion class so not a lot of work. really fun, very nice. my favorite teacher.
Consistently unprepared, and although he doesn't grade grammar harshly, is very very reluctant to give As and sometimes even Bs.

This class was a lot of fun and we had some very stimulating and interesting discussions. The quizzes are tricky, so read all the details in the readings. If you don't do the readings and pay attention, you won't do very well. The concepts discussed in class are hard to grasp sometimes, but if you ask questions he can make it easier to understand.
He is a nice guy, and loves teaching. His class was hard as crap and his concepts are hard to interpret. You better try to understand what he is saying in class and do the readings if you want an A.

I was extremely upset by this professors lack of organzation and he not once responded to my emails I sent. I know he was having some family issues so maybe that is why he was a wreck. The readings can be difficult to finish if you have a full load and his lectures can be interesting but he is hard to follow. Good luck !
I took his World Lit II class and actually had a great time. His class was the highlight of my schedule. This is not to say it was easy, but he challenges you in a way that is motivating and fun.
Great Teacher, you really learn alot about how to write your essays and how to write creatively to force the reader to thinl a certain way. the only bad thing is that he gives alot of homework.
If I would create me an English Prof on my own - his name would be Iraj
I love him,his the best prof !!!!!

Very knowlegeable, and helpful teacher. He is easy on the students, but he does assign quite a bit of writing assignments. He gives you a chance to better your grade by revising your paper. Well recomended

He's an amazing teacher with a great personality. I hate English class in general and fail completely at grammar and spelling but that doesn't matter to him. He's easy going and willing to help, my entire class is conspiring to get in the same class with him again. He even let us watch 300!

I had him for World Lit II, which unfortunately for him is just about everyone’s least favorite subject, but he had a great attitude and loved to know more about you as a person. His readings were at times impossible to complete when you’re juggling 3 other classes and work, and his class was very boring (and mandatory).
He is a good teacher, but sometimes it is hard to understand what he means. If you ask him, though, he'll clarify. Great teacher, a little much work, but overall I'd reccomend him.
cool dude, but you do have to keep up with reading!

Great teacher! Teaches you how to write and write well. He doesnt teach the class to give you a grade he teaches it to help you learn! If you do your work you will make an A no questions asked! Take his class!

Great professor!! There are quizzes on the stories read every class, but the stories are very easy to read. There is no final, but a very simple straight foward essay. No tests, but one midterm to which he gives a very helpfull study sheet. I would def take him again if I could!!

Dr. Omidvar is one of the best teachers I've ever had.  He is flexible and straightforward.  He makes class fun, listens to your ideas, and really gets you to think about the English language and the functions of words.  Would definately take him again!
Excellent instructor. Fair, helpful, and makes class interesting with his sense of humor. Do the assigned work and be prepared for class (pop quizzes) and you will do OK.
He explains everything and makes sure the class as a whole gets it. I learned a lot in his Grammer class and was really surprised how he actually got me to learn sentance diagrams.
Class is EXTREMELY hard, but teacher is cool, and understanding!

Dr. Omidvar is so cool.  Despite the fact that grammar isn't very easy, I've fallen in love with it because of Dr. Omidvar's excellent teaching style.  He encourages class participation and expects you to have done the (non-credit) homework, and be ready to answer questions and pop quizes. Study hard, you'll do great.
HE is an awesome techer!! Very Funny!! You must read the stories to make the grades!
One of the best instructors i've ever had.

Great teacher and is really interested in suggestions from the students and what they think. He cares more about your understanding of the material, so isn't concerned about tardiness, eating in class, etc.
Great professor, hard class. Unless you're a wiz at grammar, be prepared to study a lot! Open book tests but they are still difficult. He is so helpful and nice though.
Completely agree with previous comment.  Extremely helpful.  Keeps class interesting.  Wasnt bored at all.  Not easy but not hard papers.

An awesome teach and very helpful.  there was only 3 papers.  There was other work besides the papers, but they helped with writing your paper. Attendence is required!! There's no reason not to get an A/B in this class.
No Comments
